disease: Common Cold  Runny Nose  Sneezing  Cough
cure: Rest, stay hydrated, take vitamin C, use steam inhalation, and consider over-the-counter decongestants.

disease: Influenza  Fever  Body Aches  Fatigue
cure: Drink plenty of fluids, rest, take antiviral medications if prescribed, and use fever reducers like acetaminophen.

disease: Migraine  Headache  Sensitivity to Light  Nausea
cure: Rest in a dark room, use a cold compress, stay hydrated, and take prescribed migraine medications.

disease: Sinusitis  Stuffy Nose  Facial Pain  Pressure in Head
cure: Use saline nasal spray, stay hydrated, inhale steam, and take antihistamines or decongestants.

disease: Strep Throat  Sore Throat  Fever  Swollen Lymph Nodes
cure: Take prescribed antibiotics (penicillin or amoxicillin), drink warm fluids, and use throat lozenges.

disease: Asthma  Shortness of Breath  Wheezing  Chest Tightness
cure: Use prescribed inhalers (bronchodilators), avoid allergens, and take corticosteroids if needed.

disease: Bronchitis  Persistent Cough  Chest Congestion  Mucus
cure: Drink warm fluids, use a humidifier, avoid smoking, and take cough suppressants or bronchodilators.

disease: Pneumonia  Fever  Chills  Shortness of Breath  Chest Pain
cure: Take prescribed antibiotics (if bacterial), get rest, stay hydrated, and use oxygen therapy if severe.

disease: Tuberculosis  Chronic Cough  Night Sweats  Weight Loss
cure: Take a full course of prescribed antibiotics (isoniazid, rifampin), maintain good nutrition, and avoid spreading infection.

disease: Ear Infection  Ear Pain  Fluid Drainage  Hearing Loss
cure: Take antibiotics if bacterial, use warm compresses, and take pain relievers like ibuprofen.

disease: Conjunctivitis  Red Eyes  Itching  Discharge
cure: Use antibiotic or antihistamine eye drops, maintain eye hygiene, and avoid touching the eyes.

disease: COVID-19  Fever  Cough  Loss of Smell  Shortness of Breath
cure: Rest, stay hydrated, monitor oxygen levels, take antiviral medications (if prescribed), and isolate.

disease: Chickenpox  Itchy Rash  Blisters  Fever
cure: Take antihistamines for itching, keep skin cool, use calamine lotion, and get plenty of rest.

disease: Measles  Fever  Rash  Cough  Conjunctivitis
cure: Rest, drink fluids, take vitamin A supplements, and use fever reducers if necessary.

disease: Mumps  Swollen Glands  Fever  Muscle Pain
cure: Rest, apply warm compresses, drink fluids, and take pain relievers like acetaminophen.

disease: Dengue Fever  High Fever  Joint Pain  Rash
cure: Rest, stay hydrated, take paracetamol for fever, and avoid NSAIDs like ibuprofen.

disease: Typhoid Fever  High Fever  Abdominal Pain  Weakness
cure: Take prescribed antibiotics (ciprofloxacin or azithromycin), drink oral rehydration solutions, and eat easily digestible food.

disease: Malaria  Fever  Chills  Sweating  Headache
cure: Take prescribed antimalarial drugs (artemether-lumefantrine, chloroquine) and avoid mosquito bites.

disease: Food Poisoning  Vomiting  Diarrhea  Stomach Cramps
cure: Stay hydrated, drink oral rehydration solution, rest, and eat bland foods.

disease: Gastroenteritis  Nausea  Vomiting  Diarrhea  Stomach Pain
cure: Drink electrolyte-rich fluids, eat small frequent meals, and take probiotics.

disease: Ulcers  Stomach Pain  Bloating  Nausea
cure: Take prescribed proton pump inhibitors (omeprazole), avoid spicy foods, and reduce stress.

disease: Appendicitis  Severe Abdominal Pain  Nausea  Fever
cure: Immediate medical attention required; surgery (appendectomy) is the standard treatment.

disease: Hepatitis B  Jaundice  Fatigue  Dark Urine
cure: Take antiviral medications if needed, avoid alcohol, and maintain a healthy diet.

disease: Diabetes  Frequent Urination  Excessive Thirst  Fatigue
cure: Maintain a healthy diet, monitor blood sugar levels, exercise, and take prescribed insulin or medications.

disease: Hypertension  High Blood Pressure  Headaches  Dizziness
cure: Reduce salt intake, exercise regularly, manage stress, and take prescribed antihypertensive drugs.

disease: Heart Disease  Chest Pain  Shortness of Breath  Fatigue
cure: Adopt a heart-healthy diet, exercise, avoid smoking, and take prescribed medications like beta-blockers.

disease: Stroke  Sudden Weakness  Slurred Speech  Numbness
cure: Immediate emergency treatment required; physical therapy and medications for prevention.

disease: Arthritis  Joint Pain  Stiffness  Swelling
cure: Take anti-inflammatory medications, do gentle exercises, and apply hot/cold therapy.

disease: Osteoporosis  Bone Weakness  Frequent Fractures
cure: Take calcium and vitamin D supplements, do weight-bearing exercises, and take prescribed medications if needed.

disease: Anemia  Fatigue  Pale Skin  Shortness of Breath
cure: Increase iron intake (green leafy vegetables, red meat), take iron supplements, and treat underlying causes.

disease: Epilepsy  Seizures  Confusion  Loss of Consciousness
cure: Take prescribed anticonvulsant drugs, avoid triggers, and ensure a safe environment during seizures.

disease: Parkinson’s Disease  Tremors  Slow Movement  Stiffness
cure: Take prescribed dopamine-enhancing medications, do physical therapy, and engage in regular exercise.

disease: Alzheimer’s Disease  Memory Loss  Confusion  Behavioral Changes
cure: Take prescribed medications (donepezil, memantine), maintain a routine, and ensure a supportive environment.

disease: Depression  Persistent Sadness  Fatigue  Sleep Issues
cure: Seek therapy, engage in physical activity, practice mindfulness, and take prescribed antidepressants if needed.

disease: Anxiety  Excessive Worry  Rapid Heartbeat  Sweating
cure: Practice deep breathing, engage in relaxation exercises, and consider therapy or medications if severe.

disease: Schizophrenia  Hallucinations  Disorganized Thinking  Delusions
cure: Take prescribed antipsychotic medications, undergo therapy, and maintain a strong support system.

disease: Insomnia  Difficulty Sleeping  Fatigue  Irritability
cure: Establish a bedtime routine, avoid caffeine before sleep, and take melatonin or sleep aids if needed.

disease: Skin Allergies  Itchy Rash  Swelling  Redness
cure: Apply antihistamine creams, take allergy medications, and avoid triggers.

disease: Eczema  Dry Skin  Itching  Redness
cure: Use hypoallergenic moisturizers, avoid irritants, and apply prescription topical steroids if necessary.

disease: Psoriasis  Scaly Patches  Itchy Skin  Redness
cure: Use medicated creams, light therapy, and take prescribed immune-modulating drugs.

disease: Acne  Pimples  Oily Skin  Redness
cure: Use benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid treatments, maintain skin hygiene, and avoid oily cosmetics.

disease: UTI  Painful Urination  Frequent Urge to Urinate  Lower Abdominal Pain
cure: Drink plenty of water, take prescribed antibiotics, and maintain good hygiene.

disease: Kidney Stones  Severe Pain in Side  Blood in Urine  Vomiting
cure: Drink lots of water, take pain relievers, and undergo lithotripsy or surgery if necessary.

disease: Common Coldcoughsore throatcongestion
cure: Rest, drink fluids, use over-the-counter decongestants, take pain relievers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen, and use throat lozenges. If symptoms persist, consult a doctor.

disease: Flufeverchillsmuscle achesfatigue
cure: Rest, drink plenty of fluids, take antiviral medications (e.g., oseltamivir) within 48 hours of onset, and use over-the-counter fever reducers.

disease: Stomach Flunauseavomitingdiarrheastomach cramps
cure: Stay hydrated with water, clear soups, or oral rehydration solutions. Avoid solid food until symptoms subside. Medications like anti-nausea drugs may help, but see a doctor if dehydration occurs.

disease: Allergic Rhinitissneezingrunny noseitchy eyesnasal congestion
cure: Use antihistamines (e.g., loratadine, cetirizine), nasal corticosteroids (e.g., fluticasone), avoid allergens, and consider allergy shots for long-term relief.

disease: Asthmawheezingshortness of breathchest tightness
cure: Use bronchodilators (e.g., albuterol) as prescribed, inhaled corticosteroids (e.g., fluticasone), avoid triggers, and engage in regular exercise to improve lung function.

disease: Diabetes Type 1increased thirstfrequent urinationfatigueweight loss
cure: Insulin therapy is essential, monitor blood sugar regularly, follow a healthy diet, and engage in physical activity to maintain blood sugar levels.

disease: Diabetes Type 2increased thirstfrequent urinationfatigueblurred vision
cure: Lifestyle changes (diet and exercise), oral medications like metformin, and possibly insulin therapy. Regular blood sugar monitoring is crucial.

disease: Hypertensionheadachesdizzinesschest pain
cure: Monitor blood pressure regularly, take prescribed antihypertensive medications (e.g., ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers), and adopt a healthy diet low in salt and rich in fruits and vegetables.

disease: Heart Attackchest painshortness of breathnausea
cure: Immediate emergency care, medications like aspirin and blood thinners, possibly surgery like angioplasty or coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) depending on the severity.

disease: Strokesudden numbnessconfusiondifficulty speakingsevere headache
cure: Immediate medical attention, clot-busting medications (e.g., tPA), surgery for hemorrhagic strokes, and rehabilitation therapies to regain lost skills.

disease: Chickenpoxrashfeverfatigue
cure: Symptomatic treatment (calamine lotion, acetaminophen), antiviral medications (e.g., acyclovir) for severe cases, avoid scratching to prevent scarring.

disease: Measlescoughrashfeverred eyes
cure: Supportive care with fever reducers, vitamin A supplements, and keeping hydrated. Seek medical attention if symptoms worsen.

disease: Tuberculosiscoughweight lossnight sweatsfever
cure: Long-term antibiotic therapy (e.g., rifampin, isoniazid), treatment duration usually 6-9 months, and close monitoring by healthcare providers.

disease: Bronchitispersistent coughwheezingchest discomfort
cure: Symptomatic treatment with cough suppressants, hydration, and over-the-counter pain relievers. Antibiotics may be prescribed if bacterial infection is suspected.

disease: Pneumoniacoughfevershortness of breathchest pain
cure: Antibiotics (for bacterial cases), antivirals (for viral causes), oxygen therapy if needed, rest, and plenty of fluids.

disease: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)chronic coughshortness of breathwheezing
cure: Bronchodilators, corticosteroids, oxygen therapy, smoking cessation, pulmonary rehabilitation programs, and avoiding irritants.

disease: Sinusitisnasal congestionfacial painheadache
cure: Nasal decongestants, saline nasal sprays, and antibiotics if the infection is bacterial. Surgery may be needed for chronic cases.

disease: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)heartburnregurgitationchest pain
cure: Antacids, proton pump inhibitors (e.g., omeprazole), H2 blockers, and lifestyle changes such as avoiding large meals and not lying down after eating.

disease: Ulcerative Colitisabdominal paindiarrheablood in stool
cure: Anti-inflammatory medications (e.g., mesalamine), immunosuppressants (e.g., azathioprine), and in severe cases, surgery (colectomy).

disease: Crohn's Diseaseabdominal paindiarrheaweight lossfatigue
cure: Anti-inflammatory medications (e.g., corticosteroids), immunosuppressants, antibiotics, and sometimes surgery if complications occur.

disease: Gallstonesabdominal painnauseavomiting
cure: Surgical removal of the gallbladder (cholecystectomy), medications to dissolve stones, and dietary changes.

disease: Appendicitisabdominal painnauseavomitingfever
cure: Immediate surgery to remove the appendix (appendectomy) is the standard treatment.

disease: Hepatitis Afatiguenauseajaundice
cure: Rest, hydration, and a healthy diet. Hepatitis A usually resolves on its own, but avoid alcohol and consult a doctor.

disease: Hepatitis Bfatiguenauseajaundiceabdominal pain
cure: Antiviral medications, regular monitoring of liver function, and vaccination for prevention in at-risk individuals.

disease: Hepatitis Cfatiguenauseajaundiceabdominal pain
cure: Direct-acting antivirals (e.g., sofosbuvir, ledipasvir), and regular liver function monitoring.

disease: Kidney Stonessevere pain in the backblood in urinenausea
cure: Pain relievers, increased water intake, and sometimes surgery (lithotripsy) or procedures to remove stones.

disease: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)frequent urinationburning sensationblood in urine
cure: Antibiotics (e.g., trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole), hydration, and urinating after intercourse.

disease: Bladder Infectionfrequent urinationburning sensationcloudy urine
cure: Antibiotics (e.g., nitrofurantoin), hydration, and avoiding irritants like caffeine and alcohol.

disease: Prostatitispelvic painpainful urinationfever
cure: Antibiotics for bacterial infection, pain relievers, and sometimes alpha-blockers to relieve urinary symptoms.

disease: Chronic Kidney Diseasefatigueswollen anklesfrequent urination
cure: Blood pressure control, diet modification (low sodium, low potassium), dialysis, or kidney transplant in severe cases.

disease: Anemiafatiguepale skinshortness of breath
cure: Iron supplements, vitamin B12 injections, folic acid supplementation, and dietary changes.

disease: Thyroid Disordersweight gain/lossfatiguehair thinning
cure: Thyroid hormone replacement therapy for hypothyroidism, antithyroid medications for hyperthyroidism, and sometimes surgery.

disease: Hyperthyroidismweight lossrapid heartbeatsweating
cure: Antithyroid medications (e.g., methimazole), radioactive iodine therapy, or thyroidectomy.

disease: Hypothyroidismweight gainfatiguecold intolerance
cure: Thyroid hormone replacement (e.g., levothyroxine).

disease: Osteoarthritisjoint painstiffnessswelling
cure: Pain relievers (e.g., acetaminophen, NSAIDs), physical therapy, joint injections, and sometimes joint replacement surgery.

disease: Rheumatoid Arthritisjoint painswellingstiffnessfatigue
cure: DMARDs (e.g., methotrexate), biologics (e.g., TNF inhibitors), and corticosteroids.

disease: Fibromyalgiawidespread painfatiguesleep disturbances
cure: Pain relievers, antidepressants (e.g., duloxetine), cognitive-behavioral therapy, and regular exercise.

disease: Multiple Sclerosisvision problemsmuscle weaknessnumbness
cure: Disease-modifying therapies (e.g., interferon beta), corticosteroids for flare-ups, and physical therapy.

disease: Parkinson's Diseasetremorsbradykinesiapostural instability
cure: Dopamine replacement therapy (e.g., levodopa), physical therapy, and deep brain stimulation.

disease: Alzheimer's Diseasememory lossconfusiondifficulty completing tasks
cure: Cholinesterase inhibitors (e.g., donepezil), NMDA receptor antagonists (e.g., memantine), and supportive care.

disease: Depressionsadnessloss of interestfatigue
cure: Antidepressants (e.g., SSRIs), psychotherapy (e.g., cognitive behavioral therapy), and lifestyle changes.

disease: Anxietyexcessive worryrestlessnessdifficulty concentrating
cure: Anxiolytics (e.g., diazepam), therapy (e.g., CBT), relaxation techniques, and lifestyle changes.

disease: Schizophreniadelusionshallucinationsdisorganized thinking
cure: Antipsychotic medications (e.g., olanzapine), therapy, and social support.

disease: Bipolar Disordermood swingsextreme highs and lows
cure: Mood stabilizers (e.g., lithium), antipsychotics, psychotherapy, and lifestyle modifications.

disease: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)intrusive thoughtscompulsive behaviors
cure: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), and sometimes exposure therapy.

disease: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)flashbacksnightmaresanxiety
cure: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), medication (SSRIs), exposure therapy, and support groups.

disease: Insomniadifficulty falling asleepstaying asleep
cure: Cognitive-behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I), sleep hygiene, medication (e.g., melatonin or benzodiazepines) for short-term use.

disease: Restless Leg Syndromeurge to move legsdiscomfort at night
cure: Dopamine agonists (e.g., pramipexole), iron supplements, and lifestyle changes.

disease: Psoriasisred patches with silvery scalesitching
cure: Topical treatments (e.g., steroids, vitamin D analogs), phototherapy, and systemic medications (e.g., methotrexate).

disease: Acnepimplesblackheadsoily skin
cure: Topical treatments (benzoyl peroxide, retinoids), oral antibiotics, and hormonal therapy.

disease: Psoriatic Arthritisjoint painstiffnessred scaly patches on the skin
cure: NSAIDs, DMARDs (e.g., methotrexate), biologics, and physical therapy.

disease: Cellulitisredswollen skinpainfever
cure: Antibiotics (e.g., penicillin), wound care, and rest.

disease: Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV)cold soresblisters
cure: Antiviral medications (e.g., acyclovir, valacyclovir), pain relievers, and avoiding triggers.

disease: Shinglespainful rashblistersburning sensation
cure: Antiviral medications (e.g., acyclovir), pain relievers, and sometimes corticosteroids.

disease: Lyme Diseaserashfeverheadachefatigue
cure: Antibiotics (e.g., doxycycline) if caught early, and symptom management.

disease: Malariachillsfeversweatingfatigue
cure: Antimalarial medications (e.g., chloroquine, artemisinin-based treatments).

disease: Typhoid Feverfeverabdominal painweakness
cure: Antibiotics (e.g., ciprofloxacin, ceftriaxone), and hydration.

disease: Whooping Coughsevere coughing fitswheezing
cure: Antibiotics, cough medications, and supportive care.

disease: Dengue Feverfeverjoint painrash
cure: Supportive care (hydration, pain relievers), and rest.

disease: Zika Virusfeverrashjoint pain
cure: Symptomatic treatment (hydration, fever relievers), avoid mosquito bites.

disease: COVID-19fevercoughshortness of breathfatigue
cure: Rest, hydration, antiviral medications (e.g., remdesivir), oxygen therapy for severe cases.

disease: Strep Throatsore throatfeverswollen lymph nodes
cure: Antibiotics (e.g., penicillin), pain relievers, and rest.

disease: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)rednessitchingwatery eyes
cure: Antibiotics (for bacterial cases), antihistamines (for allergic cases), and warm compresses.

disease: Concussionheadachenauseadizzinessconfusion
cure: Rest, avoid strenuous activity, and monitor for worsening symptoms. Seek medical attention if symptoms persist.

disease: Fracturespainswellingbruisinginability to move
cure: Immobilization (cast or splint), pain management, surgery for complex fractures.

disease: Sprains and Strainspainswellingbruising
cure: Rest, ice, compression, and elevation (R.I.C.E.), pain relievers.

disease: Tendonitispainswellingtenderness
cure: Rest, ice, anti-inflammatory medications, physical therapy.

disease: Carpal Tunnel Syndromenumbnesstinglingpain in hand
cure: Wrist splints, physical therapy, corticosteroid injections, and sometimes surgery.

disease: COVID-19  cough  fever  difficulty breathing
cure: Rest, hydration, fever reducers like acetaminophen, antivirals (Paxlovid, Remdesivir), oxygen therapy for severe cases.

disease: HIV/AIDS  weak immune system  recurrent infections
cure: Antiretroviral therapy (ART), regular monitoring, healthy diet, and infection prevention.

disease: Tuberculosis  chronic cough  night sweats  weight loss
cure: Long-term antibiotics (Isoniazid, Rifampin, Pyrazinamide, Ethambutol), proper ventilation.

disease: Malaria  chills  sweating  high fever
cure: Antimalarial drugs (Chloroquine, Artemisinin-based therapies), mosquito prevention.

disease: Hepatitis B  jaundice  liver pain  fatigue
cure: Antiviral medications (Tenofovir, Entecavir), liver monitoring, vaccination for prevention.

disease: Influenza  body aches  sore throat  fever
cure: Antivirals (Oseltamivir, Zanamivir), rest, hydration, flu vaccine for prevention.

disease: Dengue Fever  severe headache  joint pain  rash
cure: Supportive care, fluids, acetaminophen (avoid NSAIDs), mosquito prevention.

disease: Ebola  bleeding  high fever  vomiting
cure: Supportive care (IV fluids, electrolytes), monoclonal antibodies (Inmazeb), strict isolation.

disease: Zika Virus  rash  fever  joint pain  red eyes
cure: Symptomatic relief (rest, hydration, pain relievers), mosquito control.

disease: Cholera  severe diarrhea  dehydration
cure: Oral rehydration therapy (ORT), IV fluids, antibiotics (Doxycycline, Azithromycin).

disease: Typhoid Fever  high fever  abdominal pain  weakness
cure: Antibiotics (Ciprofloxacin, Azithromycin), hydration, proper sanitation.

disease: Plague  swollen lymph nodes  fever  chills
cure: Antibiotics (Streptomycin, Doxycycline), early detection, flea control.

disease: Meningitis  stiff neck  fever  headache
cure: Antibiotics (Ceftriaxone, Vancomycin), corticosteroids, vaccination.

disease: Sepsis  high heart rate  confusion  fever
cure: IV antibiotics, fluids, oxygen therapy, hospitalization.

disease: Lyme Disease  bullseye rash  joint pain  fatigue
cure: Antibiotics (Doxycycline, Amoxicillin), early treatment is crucial.

disease: Rabies  hydrophobia  paralysis  fever
cure: Rabies vaccine, post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP), immediate wound care.

disease: Measles  rash  high fever  cough
cure: Supportive care, Vitamin A, MMR vaccine for prevention.

disease: Tetanus  muscle stiffness  lockjaw
cure: Tetanus immunoglobulin, antibiotics (Metronidazole), muscle relaxants.

disease: Diphtheria  sore throat  difficulty breathing
cure: Diphtheria antitoxin, antibiotics (Erythromycin, Penicillin), vaccination.

disease: Pertussis (Whooping Cough)  severe cough  vomiting
cure: Antibiotics (Azithromycin, Clarithromycin), vaccination (DTaP).

disease: Cardiovascular Disease  chest pain  shortness of breath
cure: Lifestyle changes, statins, beta-blockers, aspirin, surgery if needed.

disease: Diabetes  excessive thirst  frequent urination
cure: Insulin therapy (Type 1), oral medications (Metformin), lifestyle modifications.

disease: COPD  chronic cough  shortness of breath
cure: Bronchodilators, steroids, oxygen therapy, smoking cessation.

disease: Asthma  wheezing  breathlessness
cure: Inhalers (Albuterol, Steroids), avoid triggers, allergy management.

disease: Alzheimer's  memory loss  confusion
cure: Medications (Donepezil, Memantine), cognitive therapy, caregiver support.

disease: Kidney Disease  swelling  high blood pressure
cure: Dialysis, blood pressure control, kidney transplant in severe cases.

disease: Liver Cirrhosis  jaundice  swelling  confusion
cure: Avoid alcohol, diuretics, liver transplant in end-stage cases.

disease: Parkinson's  tremors  muscle stiffness
cure: Dopamine agonists (Levodopa, Carbidopa), physical therapy.

disease: Arthritis  joint pain  stiffness
cure: Pain relievers (NSAIDs), physical therapy, joint injections.

disease: Obesity  weight gain  difficulty in movement
cure: Lifestyle changes, diet modifications, exercise, weight-loss surgery.

disease: Depression  persistent sadness  loss of interest
cure: Therapy (CBT), antidepressants (SSRIs, SNRIs), lifestyle changes.

disease: Schizophrenia  hallucinations  delusions
cure: Antipsychotic medications (Risperidone, Olanzapine), therapy.

disease: Epilepsy  seizures  confusion
cure: Antiepileptic drugs (Carbamazepine, Valproate), vagus nerve stimulation.

disease: Hypertension  high blood pressure  dizziness
cure: Lifestyle changes, antihypertensive drugs (ACE inhibitors, Beta-blockers).

disease: Stroke  weakness on one side  slurred speech
cure: Clot-busting drugs (tPA), rehabilitation therapy, lifestyle changes.

disease: Heart Attack  chest pain  left arm pain
cure: Aspirin, clot dissolvers, angioplasty, heart-healthy lifestyle.

disease: Osteoporosis  weak bones  frequent fractures
cure: Calcium, Vitamin D, bisphosphonates, weight-bearing exercises.

disease: Migraines  severe headaches  nausea
cure: Pain relievers, triptans, lifestyle changes to avoid triggers.

disease: Heatstroke  high body temperature  confusion
cure: Cooling techniques (ice packs, hydration, medical emergency care).

disease: Hypothermia  shivering  slurred speech
cure: Gradual rewarming, heated blankets, IV fluids.

disease: Dehydration  dizziness  dry mouth  weakness
cure: Oral rehydration therapy, IV fluids in severe cases.

disease: Neonatal Jaundice  yellow skin  drowsiness
cure: Phototherapy, adequate feeding, monitoring bilirubin levels.

disease: Mononucleosis  fatigue  sore throat  swollen lymph nodes  fever
cure: Rest, stay hydrated, avoid contact sports, take pain relievers, and see a doctor for severe cases.

disease: Rosacea  facial redness  visible blood vessels  bumps
cure: Topical medications (metronidazole, azelaic acid), oral antibiotics, laser therapy, and avoiding triggers like sun and spicy foods.

disease: Gout  severe joint pain  swelling  redness
cure: NSAIDs, colchicine, corticosteroids, allopurinol for prevention, dietary changes (low purine), and staying hydrated.

disease: Hemorrhoids  rectal bleeding  itching  pain
cure: Fiber supplements, sitz baths, topical creams, avoid straining, and surgery for severe cases.

disease: Varicose Veins  swollen veins  leg pain  heaviness
cure: Compression stockings, exercise, elevation, sclerotherapy, or surgery for severe cases.

disease: Sciatica  lower back pain  leg pain  numbness
cure: Physical therapy, pain relievers, hot/cold therapy, epidural injections, and surgery if severe.

disease: Plantar Fasciitis  heel pain  stiffness  morning pain
cure: Rest, ice, stretching exercises, orthotics, NSAIDs, and corticosteroid injections.

disease: Bursitis  joint pain  swelling  stiffness
cure: Rest, ice, NSAIDs, physical therapy, corticosteroid injections, and avoiding repetitive motions.

disease: Gastritis  stomach pain  nausea  bloating
cure: Antacids, proton pump inhibitors, avoid irritants (alcohol, spicy foods), and eat smaller meals.

disease: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)  abdominal pain  bloating  diarrhea  constipation
cure: Dietary changes (FODMAP diet), fiber supplements, stress management, and medications for symptoms.

disease: Diverticulitis  abdominal pain  fever  nausea
cure: Antibiotics, clear liquid diet, rest, and surgery for severe or recurrent cases.

disease: Pancreatitis  severe abdominal pain  nausea  vomiting
cure: Hospitalization, IV fluids, pain management, fasting, and treating underlying causes.

disease: Gallbladder Disease  abdominal pain  nausea  vomiting
cure: Pain management, dietary changes (low-fat), and surgical removal (cholecystectomy) if needed.

disease: Hernia  bulge  pain  discomfort
cure: Watchful waiting, lifestyle changes, and surgical repair for symptomatic cases.

disease: Celiac Disease  diarrhea  weight loss  fatigue  bloating
cure: Strict gluten-free diet, nutritional supplements, and regular monitoring.

disease: Lactose Intolerance  bloating  diarrhea  gas
cure: Avoid dairy products, use lactase supplements, and choose lactose-free alternatives.

disease: Hemochromatosis  fatigue  joint pain  abdominal pain
cure: Phlebotomy (blood removal), dietary changes (low iron), and regular monitoring.

disease: Wilson's Disease  fatigue  jaundice  tremors
cure: Chelating agents (penicillamine), zinc supplements, and liver transplant in severe cases.

disease: Gouty Arthritis  severe joint pain  swelling  redness
cure: NSAIDs, colchicine, corticosteroids, allopurinol, and dietary modifications.

disease: Lupus  joint pain  fatigue  rash  fever
cure: Anti-inflammatory medications, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, and sun protection.

disease: Sjogren's Syndrome  dry eyes  dry mouth  fatigue
cure: Artificial tears, saliva substitutes, medications to increase secretions, and treating underlying conditions.

disease: Scleroderma  skin thickening  joint pain  Raynaud's phenomenon
cure: Immunosuppressants, physical therapy, medications for specific symptoms, and regular monitoring.

disease: Polymyalgia Rheumatica  muscle pain  stiffness  fatigue
cure: Corticosteroids, gradual tapering, and monitoring for complications.

disease: Temporal Arteritis  headache  vision problems  jaw pain
cure: High-dose corticosteroids immediately, and long-term management to prevent blindness.

disease: Myasthenia Gravis  muscle weakness  drooping eyelids  difficulty swallowing
cure: Cholinesterase inhibitors, immunosuppressants, plasmapheresis, and thymectomy.

disease: Guillain-Barre Syndrome  weakness  tingling  paralysis
cure: Plasmapheresis, IV immunoglobulin, supportive care, and physical therapy.

disease: Bell's Palsy  facial weakness  drooping  difficulty closing eye
cure: Corticosteroids, eye protection, physical therapy, and antiviral medications if viral.

disease: Trigeminal Neuralgia  severe facial pain  electric shock sensations
cure: Anticonvulsants (carbamazepine), nerve blocks, and surgery for severe cases.

disease: Cluster Headaches  severe one-sided headache  eye watering  nasal congestion
cure: Oxygen therapy, triptans, preventive medications, and avoiding triggers.

disease: Tension Headaches  pressure  tightness  mild to moderate pain
cure: Stress management, relaxation techniques, over-the-counter pain relievers, and lifestyle changes.

disease: Vertigo  dizziness  spinning sensation  nausea
